author: @jeffjackson2574
text:
Macro code for convenience: {% macro render_field(field) %}
{{ field.label }}
{{ field(**kwargs)|safe }} {% if field.errors %}
    {% for error in field.errors %}
  • {{ error }}
    • {% endfor %}
{% endif %}
{% endmacro %}

author: @Vl4diii
text: !!! For the error: " not all arguments converted during string formatting" Solution options: (Originally from: Jeremy Rodrigues and Arseny Ivanov)  1.x = c.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = (%s)",                           [(thwart(username))])  2. x = c.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = (%s)", (thwart(username),)) (note the comma after thwart)  3.  x = c.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '{}'".format(thwart(username)))

author: @bgm4video
text: Python3 SOLUTION to *not all arguments converted during string formatting*: You should explicitly state that it is a tuple. Don't ask why, I don't know but this worked for me. x = c.execute("SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = %s", (username,)). Original post by Igor Smirnov. VERY HELPFUL!!

author: @spizeck
text: Just a little FYI to everyone. WTForms 3.0 changed a couple things. TextField alias for StringField is deprecated and validators.Required is now validators.DataRequired. See https://wtforms.readthedocs.org/en/latest/whats_new.html
